column4: Hi, would someone be able to help me with configuring a samba share of a directory?
yes
do you want the folder to have write permission for other user?
go to http://pastebin.ca/449603 and change what should be changed and afterwards put it in /etc/samba/smb.conf
mainly change the path and writeable to no
also in smb.conf in the Authentication section you have to have security = share
I have it set up with guest ok and read only and such.
is it working?
and security =share
No, that's how I started out.
after modification did you restar samba?
Yep.
and it doesn't work. Can you see your folder?
When I go to my ip address I can see the folder I want shared, but when I click it, it says my permission might be denied.
you don't have a ; before security = share right?
I can post my  smb.conf if you want
Nope, no semi-colon.
Posting your smb.conf would probably help.
http://pastebin.ca/449610
I have to go for lunch. pm if if it works or not
Thanks.
do you know what to do beyond what you had in the samba conf file?  Because I am still having a hell of a lot of trouble...
no, it worked for me after that
Damn... I still get an error that seems to be a permission denial
